data.title: Rescue
data.meta_description: J ustin Sempsrott MD started as an ocean lifeguard in 1996 before working EMS, then becoming an Emergency Medicine Physician. He is a cofounder of Lifeguards Without Borders and the International...
data.text:
Justin Sempsrott MD started as an ocean lifeguard in 1996 before working EMS, then becoming an Emergency Medicine Physician. He is a cofounder of Lifeguards Without Borders and the International Drowning Researchers’ Alliance. He currently serves as medical director for StarGuard Elite and the International Surf Lifesaving Association.

Rob Williams is the retired Chief Lifeguard for the Newport Beach Fire Department, Marine Operations Division. He worked at the City for 33 years in all facets of ocean lifeguarding, including the last seven as the Chief. During his tenure in Newport Beach, he was involved in training of both new and returning employees, developing and delivering curriculum to meet local, state and federal standards. Rob sat on the executive board as both Vice President and Treasurer for the United States Lifesaving Association for over 12 years. He organized and was the first president of the California Marine Safety Chiefs Association, which includes the lifeguard leadership of open water agencies throughout California. In retirement, Rob serves on the California Governor’s Medal of Valor committee through the Department of Justice, along with assisting in various organizations involving water safety and drowning prevention.
